quiz.text: What is the difference between selling price of cotton grown in 2017 and lady finger grown in 2020?
options: Rs. 81, 200
Rs. 74, 800
Rs. 76, 900
Rs. 84, 600
Rs. 86, 900

quiz.text: What is the ratio between selling price of Bajra in rabi season and selling price of bajra in khariff season?
options: 2: 3
6: 7
5: 8
8: 5
7: 6

quiz.text: By what approximate percentage is selling price of rice in 2019 less than selling price of rice in 2018?
options: 25%
20%
10%
5%
15%

quiz.text: Calculate average selling price of crops in khariff season from year 2017 to year 2020.
options: Rs 1, 80, 465
Rs 1, 74, 285
Rs 1, 56, 425
Rs 1, 97, 375
Rs 1, 79, 375

quiz.text: What is the ratio of crop cultivated in khariff season and rabi season?
options: 576: 676
612:729
693:676
488: 576
None of the above

quiz.text: A shopkeeper offers two successive discounts of __________% and __________% on an article and is still able to earn 20% profit. If he offers only a single discount of 40%, he will earn 80% profit. Which of the following values will fill the blanks in the same order? A) 40 and 50 B) 50 and 30 C) 20 and 50 D) 40 and 30
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
Only D
None of the four pairs will fill the blanks

quiz.text: A Motorbikes company first raises the price of motorbikes by  a% and then reduces all the new prices by  a%. After one Motorbike, the price of Motorbike decreased by Rs. 990; and after the second Motorbike the Bike was sold for Rs. 43010. The original price of the Motorbike is ______?
options: 15%, Rs 44000
20%, Rs 42000
22%, Rs 41250
10%, Rs 47500
None of these

quiz.text: On an Edu tech website, the selling price of an online course after giving a 70% festival discount offer is ₹ 750. The rate of course on normal days is ________ which gives a 30% discount on the marked price?
options: ₹ 1800
₹ 2500
₹ 1750
₹ 1950
₹ 1450

quiz.text: A dishonest dealer claims to sell a product at its cost price. He uses a counterfeit weight which is 20% less that the real weight. Further greed overtook him, and he added 20% impurities to the product. The net profit percentage to the dealer is __________.
options: 44%
40%
50%
56.25%
60%

quiz.text: Ram enters a shop to buy a fitness band for his sister. The shopkeeper gives him the discount of 15% on the marked price of the fitness band and still he earns the profit of 25%. The amount of profit earned by shopkeeper is Rs. 5100. The marked price of the fitness band is Rs ________.
options: Rs 30, 000
Rs 28, 000
Rs 25, 000
Rs 32, 000
Rs 35, 000

quiz.text: What is the marked price of the scarf? Statement I. A shopkeeper purchases 2 scarfs for Rs. 2200 and earns Rs. 55 per scarf after giving a 23% discount. Statement II. A shopkeeper marks the price 36% more than the cost price and earns Rs. 200 after giving some discount.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: What is the selling price of the Bed if the Dealer sells at a profit of 15%? I. Dealer marks bed 60% above the cost price and allows a discount of 25%. If no discount is offered then he would get Rs. 1920 more profit. II. Dealer marks bed 75% above the cost price and after allowing two successive discounts of 20% sold to Simmu, Simmu sold it to Jayesh for Rs. 6720 and claims of profit 25%. III. Dealer marks bed 75% above the cost price and after allowing a discount of 25% sells it to customer. If he allows an addition discount of 20% he would get Rs 1260 less.
options: All I, II and III together are sufficient to answer the question.
Either I or II or III alone are sufficient.
Both I and II are sufficient to answer the question.
Both II and III are sufficient to answer the question.
None are sufficient

quiz.text: What will be the selling price of the dishwasher to make a profit of 25%? Statement I. An electronic shop dealer marks dishwasher machine 80% above the cost price and after allowing a discount of 25% he claims a profit of Rs. 3500. Statement II. A shopkeeper sold the dishwasher machine for Rs. 15000 on one condition that the shopkeeper should pay the transportation cost of the machine of Rs. 2000 and he gets a profit of 25%.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: During 2017, 2018, and 2019 the profits of Idea company changed by what percent from 2018 to 2019? Statement I. The increase in profits of Idea Company from the year 2017 to the year 2018 was the same as the increase from the year 2017 to 2019. Statement II. For Idea company the profits for the year 2017 were Rs. 20,000 crore and the profits for the year 2019 were Rs. 21,000 crores.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If data either in statement I alone or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
If data in both statements I & II are not sufficient to answer the question.
If data given in both I & II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: A dishonest shopkeeper professes to sell his articles at a cost price but uses a faulty scale while selling. What is the profit percentage the shopkeeper makes when he sells the article at a cost price?   Statement I. He uses a scale that weighs less by 25%.  Statement II. The cost price of the article is Rs. 30 per kg.  Statement III. If he has sold the articles at a 12.5% profit on cost price then his net profit percentage would have been 50%.
options: The data in statement I or III alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I and II together are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all the statements I, II, and III are not sufficient to answer the question.
None of the above.

quiz.text: Quantity A: A dishonest shopkeeper uses a faulty weight of 1800 g instead of 2 kg. What is his profit percentage? Quantity B: A dishonest shopkeeper mixes 1 kg of rice costing Rs. 24 per kg with 2 kg of rice costing Rs. 30 per kg and sold the mixture at a price of Rs. 30.8 per kg. What is his profit percentage?
options: Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity A: A got a concession of 20% on the marked price of an article and sold the product at 20% more than its original marked price. Find the profit % of A.   Quantity B: The cost price of the mobile is Rs. 10,000. The delivery charge of the mobile cost 20% of its cost price. After adding that Pihu marks up 20% on its total cost price and sells it on a 40% discount. Find loss % of Pihu.
options: Quantity: A > Quantity: B
Quantity: A < Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≥ Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≤ Quantity: B
Quantity A = Quantity B or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity A: A dishonest dealer promises to sell his goods at a 30% loss but uses 20% less weight. Find his actual loss. Quantity B: A shopkeeper promises to sell his goods at x% profit but uses 25% less weight thus gains 40%. Find x%.
options: Quantity: A > Quantity: B
Quantity: A < Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≥ Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≤ Quantity: B
Quantity A = Quantity B or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity A: A shopkeeper bought 300 pens for Rs 1200. He wanted to sell them at a profit so that he got 36 pens for free. At what profit percent should he sell them?  Quantity B: 15%
options: Quantity: A > Quantity: B
Quantity: A < Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≥ Quantity: B
Quantity: A ≤ Quantity: B
Quantity A = Quantity B or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity A: The ratio of the cost price of the two items is 3 : 4. The profit percentage earned by selling A and B is 10% and 15% respectively. The difference between the selling price of items B and A is Rs. 130. Find the ratio between the profit earned by selling B and A. Quantity B: The ratio between the age of father and mother after 10 years is 11 : 9. The average age of a daughter and mother is 27.5 years. The difference between the age of father and daughter is 25 years. Find the ratio between the present age of father and daughter.
options: Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: The cost price of 12 cups is equal to the selling price of 16 plates, and the cost price of 11 plates is equal to the selling price of 12 cups. The loss percentage on selling a cup and a plate together is 15%. Find the profit/loss percentage on selling a plate?
options: 40
50
60
70
None of these

quiz.text: The selling price of an umbrella is 333.33% more than the discount offered on the umbrella. If the ratio of the discount percentage to the profit percentage is 5: 8, what is the ratio of the amount of profit on the umbrella to the given discount?
options: 1: 1
1: 2
2: 1
3: 2
2: 3

quiz.text: The ratio of the cost price of A and B is 4 : 5 and they are marked 12.5% and 20% respectively above their cost price. If A and B are sold at a discount of 6.67% and d% respectively such that the ratio of their selling price is 7 : 9, what is the value of d?
options: 10
15
12.5
20
8

quiz.text: The cost price of A is 25% less than that of B and they are sold at same amount of profit after a discount of 22.22% and 30% respectively. If the ratio of their marked price is 7: 10, what is the ratio of their selling prices?
options: 5: 8
4: 5
7: 9
2: 3
3: 4

quiz.text: Product A and B, with cost price in the ratio 4 : 5, are sold at a profit of 10% and 20% respectively after a discount of Rs. 18 and Rs. 8 respectively. If the difference between their marked prices is Rs. 6, what is the selling price (in Rs.) of B? (Marked price of B > A)
options: 48
44
60
72
75
